Please rebase this patch on top of the work here:

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/63652

I realise that is a WIP patch, but we must not be making the problems solved by it worse (like is being done in your patch here). To get it out of the WIP state can you please help with testing it and providing feedback?

sure will do it asap.
could you please review other chain commit files also so i can address all the comment together with rebase changes.

@andrew since rashmica's changes are not in downstream so can't test her changes on downstream and as per your above comment also i am blocked to test my changes + rashmica's changes on upstream because upstream code is not stable but i and test team have tested my changes on downstream and it's working fine so we are thinking if we merge this change before rashmica's changes because her changes will take time to merge in upstream and there are only pldmd.cpp has minor conflict between two changes.

No there are not minor conflicts between the two changes. This approach will need to be reworked entirely with the patch I linked. Similarly, the patch I linked has been tested by Ampere, Meta and others and is quite close to being merged.

If you and your testers have exercised this patch downstream but are not based on upstream (and can't test it against upstream) why should we be merging it upstream before other patches that have been tested? What's the rush?

hi @andrew,
i have merged both commit but could not get chance to test in upstream changes because of unstable upstream build, once i test in upstream and downstream then will inform you.
Okay, thanks. I'll keep an eye out 😊
Hi Kamalkumar, I think some changes are still required to clarify the responsibilities. Also I think we can better exploit the specified mechanism for request/response correlation.
Why is this called "Transport" when its purpose seems to be to correlate a response with a request? I think we could find a better name.
Done
These are unused.
Done
Please delete this commented out code.
Done
Please delete this commented out code.
Done
If this is a request message can we please use a proper type representing a message, not a `std::vector`?
Done
I think this is related to the comment below about TIDs and instance IDs.
this was index which was mapped to request header then later used for replying host based on which header mapped with which index number, but now with new approach it's not required.
Can you explain this a little more? The specified way to correlate a request/response is with the pairing of requester TID with request's instance ID
removed unnecessary function with upgraded code.
Why use a separate instance here and not the one that was instantiated in `main()`? Why can't this be a reference or a shared_ptr/weak_ptr?
done as per comment
Commented out code is a maintenance headache. Please delete it.
done as per comment
Hello Kamalkumar, a few things are unclear to me and so I have some comments requesting documentation. Hopefully with that it helps the reader understand the intent, or we can trim some things out.
If we don't want it closed when it goes out of scope, why not just pass around the raw `int` value? It feels like this change defeats the purpose of the class.
Can you add some documentation here? Why is key necessary when we have the instance ID?
Can you add a comment justifying why this is necessary? It's not clear to me why we need it.
I don't think there's a lot of value in holding a unique_ptr here when the only thing we do is fetch the raw pointer out and pass it around.
